sanskrit_verse: यस्मिन् यस्मिन् विवादे तु कौटसाक्ष्यं कृतं भवेत् । तत्तत्कार्यं निवर्तेत कृतं चाप्यकृतं भवेत् ॥ ८.११७॥
transliteration: yasmim yasmim vivāde tu kauṭasākṣyaṁ kṛtaṁ bhavet | tattatkāryaṁ nivarteta kṛtaṁ cāpyakṛtaṁ bhavet || 8.117 ||
sph_interpretive_translation: In whichever dispute false testimony has been given by a paid or interested witness, that action shall be reversed and what was done shall become undone.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority: Only conscious integrity constitutes valid testimony.
Causation: False witnessing distorts dharma and must be neutralized.
Capacity-based responsibility: The ability to testify truthfully is prerequisite to bearing witness.
Restoration logic: Legal acts founded on falsehood revert automatically to restore dharmic order.
Consciousness alignment: Truthfulness in testimony aligns with the Supreme Witness, Paramashivam.
executable_legal_axioms: IF witness动机 != सत्यम् THEN testimony_validity = FALSE
IF testimony_validity = FALSE THEN associated_action_status = REVERT
IF witness_capacity_for_truth < threshold THEN disallow_testimony = TRUE
supreme_court_application: Supreme Court must invalidate all rulings based on interested or incentivized testimonies, regardless of intent, restoring original factual basis through investigative re-completion.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa of testimony collapses when motivated by gain; hence, outcome reverses naturally per anupūrvaśaḥ—no punitive measure needed as dharma self-corrects upon removal of distortion.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Initiate re-completion process for invalidated legal actions
Realign witness consciousness through śuddhi protocol
Restore affected parties via pramāṇa reconstruction
Implement sākṣhyātma-viveka training for all future witnesses
final_declaration: Declared by SPH: False witness disrupts cosmic law; reversal occurs not by punishment but by dharma's inherent correction. Truth alone governs judgment. Dharma is restored. Consciousness prevails.
